abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Farm
            Reconstruction Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, project sustainability
            was uncertain, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the design of an emergency reconstruction
            project should be simple and such that implementation can be
            accomplished quickly and benefits generated without an undue
            gestation period, as was the case with this project.
            Provision should be made for engaging technical assistance
            as needed from preparation through the first year of
            implementation. Even under pressures of an emergency, it is
            preferable to carefully canvass the beneficiaries concerning
            their specific needs and preferences and procure goods and
            services that match these as closely as possible. Where
            required accompanying measures, such as extension advice,
            inputs, operating credit or marketing assistance, cannot be
            included, which is often the case with emergency projects,
            efforts should be made as soon as possible to have such
            measures provided by the borrower or included in
            supplementary operations financed by the Bank or other agencies.
